src:
Vamos bien, no hay nada que temer: AMLO
El mandatario publicó, en su cuenta de Twitter, un video desde Palenque, en el que señala que el pueblo está respaldando a su administración.
03 Nov 2019, 15:39 by Notimex
El presiente Andrés Manuel López Obrador destacó que su balance es que México va muy bien porque su administración está cumpliéndole al pueblo, y éste lo está respaldando.
En un breve mensaje, grabado en Palenque y difundido a través de su Twitter, explicó que como parte de la tradición del Día de Muertos recordó a sus difuntos, entre ellos su papá, su mamá, su hermano y su exesposa Rocío.
El mandatario destacó que los días que se tomó le sirvieron para descansar y reflexionar sobre lo que está ocurriendo en su administración.
“Creo que vamos bien. Ese es mi balance, no hay nada qué temer, vamos muy bien”, recalcó el mandatario, quien añadió que esto sucede así porque “estamos cumpliéndole al pueblo y el pueblo nos está apoyando, nos está respaldando”.
text:
We are doing well, there is nothing to fear: AMLO
The president published, on his Twitter account, a video from Palenque, in which he points out that the town is supporting his administration.
03 Nov 2019, 15:39 by Notimex
President Andrés Manuel López Obrador stressed that his balance is that Mexico is doing very well because his administration is fulfilling the people, and he is supporting it.
In a brief message, recorded in Palenque and disseminated through his Twitter, he explained that as part of the Day of the Dead tradition he remembered his deceased, including his father, his mother, his brother and his ex-wife Rocío.
The president stressed that the days he took served to rest and reflect on what is happening in his administration.
“I think we are doing well. That is my balance, there is nothing to fear, we are doing very well, ”said the president, who added that this happens because“ we are fulfilling the people and the people are supporting us, they are supporting us ”.
